review: I used to love this Red Robin but the fact that they now serve 12 fries per burger is so stingy!   We're talking about potatoes people. I understand cutting back due to costs but when you charge the same amount as Burger King it might be time to increase your menu prices by a dollar. In the hour that the four of us were there we were never offered refills on our drinks and the three dirty tables next to us never got bussed. It was about 4 p.m. and not very busy. Management needs to highly consider revamping their game plan. There's a Brewery next door and people are not going to come back if there is an alternative. Save your money and go to Herfy's.
Great food and service. The fries are my favorite with sweet and spicy ketchup and smoked bacon. Excellent. The French onion soup and their burgers are delicious.

We went in around 11 when they opened and received the best service and best food we have every had. Only problems were that the floors felt slippery (the worker said it was a problem with the type of floor they had installed during a remodel...) and the women's bathroom was disgusting. Those things aside, our visit was perfect!

Poor service!! Wait was expected. But the second we sat down, 1st thing we were told was there were not soft drinks or lemonade. So it was either water, shakes or smoothies.  My husband got a shake, and was mostly whip cream and cookies and very little ice cream....probably because it's all they had to serve. Then it took about 45 min to an hour to get our food, which was not even fresh!! Cold fries, room temp burgers. We didn't even bother to eat, we just walked out. Considering, we are a family who rarely goes out to eat, we are extremely disappointed on our outing to to Red Robin Puyallup

What happened to the Bird?  Haven't been to Red Robin in a while. The burger selection is still great but bottomless fries?  How about starting with a full order. If you want to prevent waste-maybe ask "hey you guys like a lot of fries?"  Then after someone asks for more-go get the order.  It is fries- not a steak "cooked to order"-You should always have tons ready, especially if you advertise "bottomless".   Not sure of other locations but the outside of the men's bathroom door looks like it came from a Union 76 gas station just off the freeway.  General appearance was cleanliness isn't job #1.  The black plate my burger was presented on had more greasy fingerprints then the back windows of a mini-van.  The place was packed and the staff was busy. One more suggestion-get rid of the automation.

We haven't been here for a very long time but thought we would give it another try. We were disappointed once again. I am giving it a Two star due to the great waitress we had. However, the food has horrible. My fish was cold and the fry's were cold and soggy.... Disgusting! I only ate a few bites. By the time the fresh fry's that we requested had come, we were done and needed to leave. No more Red Robin for us.

I'd give this 3 stars but the server, Telysha, was very unhelpful and abrasive. I went with my grandma. And her being elderly would typically need a little more assistance and explanations that she didn't even attempt to offer. She was very shorthanded with her answers and very standoffish. I would definitely point out to not ask for her as a server when arriving, if I ever come back again. The service was just so bad. She even was talking bad about other patrons, as well as us, just one table away. So unprofessional and a bad attitude.

Slow afternoon very slow service waitresses fine but she couldn't deliver the food any faster than the kitchen prepared it. I was very disappointed because my wedgy burger set under the warming light for a long time. I could tell because my salad was all wilted and warm in the burger was not hot. There was no apology there was no explanation there was no effort to make things right.

Food was average, same as all the other Red Robins I've been to.  But I would say I like the service here the least, although my sister says the service is horrible in Lakewood, which I haven't been to that one yet.  We did get our order pretty quickly, but our waitress didn't come check on us for a while, which would have been okay if we weren't in need of fries refills.  We finally were able to ask for refills, and when she brought more fries, she just dropped the fries off and quickly walked away.  But she stacked the metal baskets of fries on top of each other, which we felt was kind of weird.  We don't know how clean these baskets really are.  It's like ordering two plates of food, and it comes out with one plate of food sitting on another plate of food.  I don't know, maybe it's not a big deal, but we didn't like it too much.  It took a while to get her to come back after we finished; we pushed the "Call Server" button on the little machine on the table, but that didn't do any good.

Usually I'm a big fan of Red Robin, but this location was terrible the last time I went. my food looked like it was two days old & my sisters order was completely wrong. unfortunately I won't be coming back here again.
I got take out which was pokey, the bartender dismissive, the burgers good, the steak fries cold. Eh.
Awful awful experience . Our server was busy taking at the server station. Had to remind her twice to get our refills . Never going back to this location. Terrible terrible service.

This place used to be okay - not anymore. Burger ordered medium, my wife's ordered medium-well.  Not sure why they ask.  They're all burnt to a crisp.  That includes the kids burger - a hockey puck of a Boca burger on a burned bun. I suppose that's why it took 45 minutes to get our food - you can't cook that thoroughly in less time. For some reason they are super busy, so I'll let others keep them in business. Too many great places elsewhere to spend my dollars.

I probably shouldn't do this while I am still so furious, but I'm going to. I came here with my family, party of nine. Gave my name, and sat to wait. They called my name, we gathered our things, and watched them sit an entirely different party of nine that had JUST walked in the door. I pointed out the error. Even though they had not all made it to MY table, they CONTINUED to seat them and we had to wait. So now I'm sitting on a bump, crammed in a booth, by the kitchen, on my very last visit here. Oh gee. Someone broke a glass in the kitchen. And now my ears are ringing on top of it.  Sigh. The asswipes at my table? Nice and peaceful and relaxed. Hey Teal party of nine? Red Robin? You suck. Oh great, now they're dropping pans.... Headache city.

This was a so-so experience. The waitress was quite nice which gets points! Since I did choose to come during the dinner rush. I however... will keep in mnd for next time that Red Robin has quite a handful of kids dining in, so it was really loud and annoying. I ordered the Chicken Bruschetta Burger? My mom and sister shared the Veggie Burger? It was my first time trying the Chicken Bruschetta and I have to say, the bread was delicious! The chicken was chicken breast but it wasn't dry and tough!(: However, the salsa that comes inside had diced tomatoes and I asked our waitress to put it on the side but she forgot I think. I was a bit disappointed since tomatoes are somewhat disgusting to eat. However, I put some ketchup on my chicken breast and tasted sp much better. I love their fries! Yum yum yum. No need to talk on and on about the fries everyone comes to love. I tried the St. Louis Pie? With strawberries and honestly, it looked unappetizing. But dang, it tasted quite good! Maybe I was just craving sweets but vanilla ice cream, strawberries, and whatever the bottom breading was- yum yum yum(:

The restaurant was packed and we were still seating immediately after entering. The wait staff were nice, sociable and very helpful. Three kiddos were stuffed and both adults were very happy with the delicious food. The service was quick! Less than 10 min from order-receiving 5 full meals! Amazing customer service and food.

This place is great for food and groups and family gatherings. The prices are awesome I can't complain about it at all honestly. I was pretty impressed. The wait time to be seated was pretty fast. The waitresses were okay.

No reservations allowed but they encourage "call aheads" which is what our  party did for a group of 20 for a birthday Friday night. Everything was good to go for 6:30pm, arrived at 6:10 and the hostess told 3 different people in our party 3 different wait times, 20 min, 45 min and 1 hour. The planner of the birthday dinner was irritated and told the hostess we were probably going to go somewhere else but within a minute or 2 let her know we were all going to wait it out. 1 hour goes by and still no table so we asked how much longer we might expect to be waiting and they told us they sat a table of 10 in front of us and it was going to be at least another 45 min. We had going hungry kids with us and there was no way we were going to be able to wait and hour and 45 min for a table we had called ahead on so we asked to speak with a manager. The only thing he said was that earlier when we had suggested we might go somewhere else then changed our mind and stayed that put us back at the bottom of the waiting list.. I work in customer service and I've never in my life made a complaint but this was handled so inappropriately I had to say something. I haven't ever really had an issue here before but I'll never be going back.

Walked into this place around 8pm on a Sunday night.. Business was slow.. Maybe only 4 or so tables were filled. Anyway, when we arrived.. No host was at the front to have us seated. Another party of two males walk in.. The host walks out from the corner and instead of being courteous and asking who arrived first, she automatically took the two guys to go get seated. My blood boiled.. Because excuse me honey, we live in this country where racism still exists.. How do you think it looks (professionally, culturally, and sociologically) if your white ass seats white boys before brown people?! I was so irritated by the lack of courtesy and professionalism. Those two boys could have said something too. I was too shocked to have experienced this for the first time.. So I bit my tongue. I would have given this place less stars if it wasn't for one of the best customer service I have ever received from the waitor. He was so exceptional!! It reminded me of like southern hospitality.. He took our order, referred to me as ma'am and my boyfriend as sir, checked back on us to see if we needed anything else and if the food was cooked to perfection, served us bottomless fries without asking... He was just so great!!  Our burgers were cooked to perfection! I swear, I looked at my boyfriend's burger when Ryan placed it down, then I looked at my food.. Took a bite of fries.. And when I looked back at my boyfriend.. Half of his burger was gone LOL it was that "yummmm"  Before leaving, I wrote down comments about the host and our waitor (Ryan) on the back of a receipt.. I hope it got to their manager or supervisor. We definitely will be back to this specific location because of Ryan's customer service!

I've been to this Red Robin every few months for the last 10 or so years. They've gotten pricier for the same entrees and give fewer fries that have noticeably declined in quality. Most recently (today) they were more like glorified potato chips since there really wasn't anything in the middle of the crunchy outside.  However, service is always good.

We came here for my daughter's bday. Is the 3rd year we do it and she loves it. Their burgers are very good and always fresh. The kids burger was big for her, she is 11. The fries are big and fresh. I had the burger with avocado let me tell you it was the best.  She always gets a free sundae for her bday and the bday song by the staff.  They are so friendly and cheerful everytime. Kids can get a balloon too.  I love the decor, it is pretty American like. I love the music they play and is not so loud, also they have televisions everywhere with sports on. The area is spacious and clean.  The parking should not be difficult since is right in the mall area, so there should be plenty for you. They also have take out so if you don't like eat there you can order to-go.  Overall great place, totally recommend it for the whole family.

Point of getting pretzels and beer cheese is for the beer cheese not having it come with fry sauce.  I don't suggest doing online orders at this location. They forget everything and quality of food isn't as good as the one closer to graham.
Wish I could give this place a negative -1 star review.... because of freaking COCKROACHES!!!!!

Happy to see there are still RedRobin locations that offer fast service and high quality servers. We will be driving the extra distance to go to this one instead of going to the awful Auburn location!

Tried out Red Robin Curbside. The sign says no unbuckling required, just call. Apparently they don't have phones here because it just rings forever and nobody picks up. Whenever they say your food will be ready, just add another 30% time on it and that's when it will be ready. And instead of the curb, just go stand in the bar where you are in everyone's way and get your own incomplete order at the "pickup station" because your order isn't getting curbside on its own.

My second time to this Red Robin with its endless drinks and fries.  Great charred burgers with or without the bun.  A must place to go with teenage kids. The college kids are always here for a good and filling meal.

Stopped in after shopping at the mall on Saturday April 29th.  It was fairly busy, but we were seated right away.  My wife and I were both very hungry, but took some time to figure out what we wanted to order.  Our server was Katie M.  and she was very patient with us.  I had asked if the promotion that we received emails about for Royalty members of spend $10 get a free appetizer was limited.  She informed us it was not, it included any appetizer.  This only prolonged our decision but we finally decided on ordering nachos, and boneless wings in addition to my Royal Red Robin burger and my wife's fish and chips.  After placing our order, we sat over 20 minutes with still no appetizers. The manager had noticed my wife's displeasure and came over to ask if everything was ok.  She told him NO I'M hungry and we still don't have our appetizers.  He said he'd look into it. He went back to the kitchen. A few minutes later he came back with our appetizers and apologized.  Immediately afterward he came back with our entrees.  We hadn't even started to eat the appetizers yet! He again apologized and said there was a bit of mix up in the kitchen so everything came out at once.  The manager said he'd take them back to the kitchen and have some new ones made up but brought out after a little while so we'd have a chance to eat the appetizers without the entrees getting cold.  He came back and check on us after we got out entrees.   I'd have to say this is the first Red Robin were I've seen the manager actually working the floor during peek hours and ensuring guests are having a good experience. So Kudos to him.  The food in general was good, but the manager's willingness to take care of his customer's was refreshing.

My boyfriend and I have been to Red Robins a handful of times but this was our first time at this one near south hill mall.  Service was quick and we had put in our order and got our food in no time. I am addicted to the burning love burger here and can't seem to push myself to try something else. I always order mine well done. However, my burger came out burnt. The charred outside of my burger was really bitter and left an unpleasant after taste in my mouth.  Despite the problem, our lunch was ok and our waitress was nice. I will continue to visit red robins but will stick to the Lakewood location.

The onions rings here were amazing! Super fresh and hot! The burgers were fresh and the fries were good. Be prepared to order lots of baskets of fries, if you like them, because they only bring you a few at a time. Customer Service is good. Definitely eating here again!

Sadly...this RR has seen better days. Compared  to the other restaurants in extremely close proximity this restaurant is capital F ..Filthy!  Just gross. We arrived maybe 45 minutes after they opened and we were seated quickly..in a booth with a shredded seat and some touch screen game thing sitting on each table...which I thought was pretty cool. We ordered and then I booked it to the bathroom to wash my hands as we had just been to BestBuy and I was touching the game controllers and couldn't stop thinking about the snot nosed kids who also touched those same controllers and I need to wash my hands asap and defiantly before eating. Aahhh the bathrooms....why is the floor so grimy..Jesus I went in there to wash my hands and feel like I may have ended up do more harm than good...why is there black stuff on the grout around the toilet...oh gawd what's splattered up the walls and why...why does the little hand plate on the door that instructs you to wash your hands before leaving soooo filthy? I think to my self...don't touch anything..go straight to your table. They just opened but there are gobs of shoe prints on the tile floor...like someone is moping with old mop water. The floors, bathroom and walls all need a good scrub and steaming..it's just gas station bathroom grimy. This only leaves me to wonder ... WTF does the Kitchen look like?!?! Surprising part is the photos on the wall did not have a inch of dust on them that you would expect to see along with the other conditions.  Food was good....the "plastic" plate was water spotted with greasy finger prints..and hubby's Bonsai burger wasn't wrapped in the paper wrap...like they use to be??? This made for extremely messy burger...not sure where the "gourmet" went..but it's not at this location. Shame on the owner of this RR...your not being held to the standards the other RR have set..and ...you fail.
The food is the norm, but the service by my girl, Jack, was superb and definitely deserves a 5 star rating!

We took the family to dinner tonight. It was a big group. I ordered the wrong thing. I offered to pay for it since it was my fault but asked for something else. Cara was our server. She removed the item from our bill. I was impressed that they did that for me. I was even more impressed by the excellent service and great food provided to us. Perfect place to take the family! Thank you!!

I seriously have been boycotting RR for TWO YEARS because of an awful fry mishap that happened waaaay back in 2014 at the Covington RR. However, my grandma and aunt wanted to do Mom's Day lunch here, so I reluctantly obliged. It's kind of unfair of me to give a review of the service here - my uncle is one of the managers and he waited on us, and my cousin is one of the bus boys. So, I mean, I think the service is fantastic and you're lucky to have either Christian or Scott working with you. ;)  I ended up getting the Avo Cobb O salad - avocado, grilled chicken breast, and bacon. It was pretty tasty and the chicken was really good, but I only had a few pieces of avocado. With its name having to do with avocado, I thought I'd get more  (and I'm an avocado fiend). I also tried the Raspberry Cream Soda and it was DELICIOUS but pretty sweet so I was only able to have one. Fried pickles are delicious as well. Maybe my boycott can come to a probation, and maybe I'll just come to this location. Who knows. Only time will tell.

The interior of this Red Robins is spectacular! Everything is nice clean and energizing. Service in my opinion, was alright. I was not happy with the fact that they do not have Tabasco sauce. What burger joint doesn't have Tabasco sauce?? Good thing I carry some in my bag (swag). As for the prices; I honestly feel like they nickel and dime you for everything. They have special sauces that come in an extremely small single serve cup for .75 which is not practical at all. They have games on the table tablets, but your going to pay $1.99 per. Over prices appetizers for such a small portion.  I recommend the Blu Ribbon Burger with a turkey burger, instead of beef. Ps: you can sub turkey, chicken, or veggie burgers for all burgers. No extra cost :)  Also: I've been to other Red Robins before, and by far this one gave the smallest portion of "bottomless" fries. I mean you can get 3 portions of their fries and its equal or less than 1 order of fries anywhere else. Very skimp on the fries.  This place is kid friendly for sure and the kids menu is decent.  All in all I probably won't be back.

Drinks are great food is yummy and fries are just delish love it. Staff are very nice and fast love that! This is the place to come with your friends for good drinks catch up and enjoy a bite. Next time you come in make sure you ask for Melissa she's amazing. On point of everything super friendly!! I will be back again soon for sure

Service slow. Orders came out at all different times. Fries cold and bland. We had 7 adults and 1 kid and the wait was over 30 minutes at 9 pm...they had.plemtymof tables available and yet they didn't seat us because the waitress already had her max amount of tables...what!?

While the food at red robin is mostly always fantastic, the service at this particular restaurant deserves nothing more than 1 star.  We came here for lunch today (Tuesday) and were seated in the most hidden corner they could find even tho the restaurant was barely even half full. When we went back to the front to request a different table, my husband and I slipped on large fat splatters on the floor. Luckily we didn't fall. However, we told the front staff about it and they shook their head and rolled their eyes on us.  Guess what?! Not ten minutes later a girl slips and smashes to the ground. She was crying in pain. The manager tried his best to make up for this. BUT all of this could have been prevented if the staff wasn't so rude and would have actually wiped the floor after we told them.

Came with a buddy forc an early dinner. We each had a Red Tavern burger with fries.  The fries were ok. We each found excessive gristle in the burger meat and small bone chips. Notified the manager who apologized but did nothing to lower our bill. The waitress was quick and efficient at least. Disappointing visit.
We were here for Spring Fair.  Had prime rib dip. Tasty.  Only got a tbsp of cole slaw.  Bummer

This is our local, neighborhood Red Robin. We come here often and generally sit in the bar. Most of the time, Kevin is our server. He always has a smile on his face with an upbeat attitude, aiming to please. Food comes out in a timely manner with consistent quality! This is our go to, never fail restaurant!

So very disappointing. Was told it was 45 min for a party of 14. Waited well over an hour in the meantime there was many parties of 6 being seated. We were never asked if it was OK to split party to nearby tables. There was a party of 25 seated b4 us and not even half of their party was there yet all our party was there. Waited over an hour for our food...Had 3 children in our party and ended up getting our food after 9:30. Cold fries, bad lettuce on salads, slow to get refills on drinks and our bottomless fries were not bottomless. never offered a discount,  complimentary appetizer... Poor  management skills. Our  over 3 hour experience very disappointing. Wanted to give no star rating, had to choose so it will be a very undeserved star.

My Family and I have eaten at this location 3x this year.  Service is usually at least average.  Last week was the last time for me. My burger had two long black hairs right on top of the burger.  No one hair, but two.  It was disgusting.  Not the "gourmet burger" they advertise.  We will not be back!

Pregnant  and asked for a well done burger with  no pink. The food took awhile to come so I had it packed up to go which was not a problem at all. I get home  cut open my burger and boom my burger should have been mooing at me because it was so pink. I am one hungry and very unhappy pregnant woman. Debating on bringing it back in the morning because I was really looking forward to enjoying a nice burger..

so between the hours of 3pm and about 5pm you might have to wait to be seated because of light staff. However the food we ordered was great including the Avo-Cabo salad and the Big Ghost burger. The salad was great, had the right amount of avocado, olives, blue cheese, ect... Ghost burger was spicy! and very tasty not all spice. service lady was nice but we felt rushed to order. overall it was a ok experience for Red Robin.
Don't waste your time coming into the bar because the food is cold and the service is slow!
This was my first time at this Red Robin. We came in right when it opened and the service and food were great!

Service is bland and we have been waiting for our food for over 30 minutes without any update from our server. The people sitting next to us were sat 10 minutes after my table and they have already received their lunch. Being in the industry, I understand food issues are out of your control, but what is in your control is keeping the communication open with your guests on what is going on. Will not be back.
This was very nice. Fast friendly. Mitch was our waiter and he did a great job. Made sure we had everything we needed thanks. I would come again.

The food was good as always. However I was disappointed in the current changes made. Instead human interaction we get a machine. The concept of streamlined service is great except the delivery failed. I was also disappointed that after they messed up my order and brought me something I didn't like after waiting an extremely long time for original food I waited again for what seemed like a long time again my burger was not comped. It really should have been. We pushed the call waiter button on the machine only to be ignored due to high customer volume. I don't think I'll be back again for a while. Clearly they aren't as dedicated to customer service as they should be

2nd time our table and seats smelled like dirty dish rag water. Maybe us clean bleach water and change it out every now and then. It makes us lose our appetite and not wanting to touch much. Disappointed! Also ordered burger without mayo, got sent back and manager brought me a new one with less mayo. Omg. They did take 25% off bill.
Raw fries. Poor service. Seriously backed up kitchen. Drinks showed up super, super late. Also, I think baskets of fries need to come with more than 6 individual fries in them.

Sept 2016. I was sitting under a TV caked with dust.  Gross Red Robin delivers a surprisingly a-ok experience, but falls short when you view the limited menu with prices on the high side.  The Burgers are sloppy, and drips from the sides of the bun and can be difficult to eat, however very tasty.  The steak fries are large, and with dipping sauce can taste great. The sevice was average, but edged on the extremely better side of average. The gourmet burgers are just that an upper level burgers you will not find at most burger establishments. For this Red Robin, I would give the customer service performance 31/2  stars, and based on the food alone I would award them 4 stars.

This last Saturday, after a fun day at the beach I was craving Red Robbin. I figured it wouldn't be too busy around 8:30 so we headed in. It wasn't too packed in there so we thought we had lucked out. We were told it would be a 20-25 minute wait to be seated. My 5 year old was with me or we would have opted for the bar. I was shocked and asked why. The hostess said they were short servers and only had 4 servers at the time. I should have listened to my gut and went to BJ's next door. We only waited about 10 minutes for a seat. We knew what we wanted already, so we ordered everything as soon as we saw our waitress Ashley, which was only a few minutes after sitting down. I still had high hopes. We waited 25 minutes for our beverages. With a thirsty 5 year old. I gave him my phone after 15 minutes to buy some peace. The manager saw us and guiltily brought over a basket of fries. Still nothing to drink. Finally our appetizer came out and still no drinks. I had to ask our poor waitress again just for water. There were 3 of us, but only 2 waters. My drink that I ordered was a lemon drop. It was awful and I should have asked for a better vodka but I didn't. Seriously gross. I didn't complain about it because it's their choice to use cheap crappy vodka and I should have asked. My husband ordered the clam chowder. It was half full and dry, as though it was the bottom of the pot. We did ask for it to be taken off. The burger and fries were amazing and thank goodness for that. Watching our waitress literally run, work her butt off and do it with a smile was impressive. Ashley was amazing and the order issues and drink problems were from lack of staff. I'm shocked that her manager let the staff go on a Saturday night. I could tell as he waited on tables he knew he made a bad decision. Yes, one that ruined several people's dining experience. On a sunny Washington Saturday, it's going to be slow until the sun goes down. It doesn't mean cut your staff. Was saving money worth a bad yelp review? Next time, I will turn around and go next door. Foods great but not worth a painful dining experience after having a great day with my family.

Great food, expensive drinks. Bill turns out twice as much as expected. The service is great. I've never had a problem besides them not putting BBQ on my sons burger lol... but easily resolved. I will continue to come here.

Been here dozens upon dozens of times for literally every reason you can think of, and never once have I ever had a negative experience. It's SUPER kid-friendly, yet adults still can find it enjoy as well. They just remodeled it actually, and I like! It's more contemporary now with a lot more TV's for sports. The food is what you expect from every Red Robin, but for the sake of discussion, I will add my meal with my SECRET TRICK!! First, start off and order the Riblets and Mac n' Cheese. In my opinion, the adults Mac n' Cheese sucks, so this one time I asked if I could get the kids kind instead. Now that, boys and girls, is some good Macaroni and Cheese. And the best part is that kids' plate IS REFILLABLE AT NO CHARGE! Bottomless Mac and Cheese you can eat, give to your kid, bring home, or whatever at no charge! Woo Hoo! Overall, average and great Red Robin. Would recommend!

I always love coming to this Red Robin. There is always great service and great food. The other night, it was super busy and we still got a seat fairly quickly and our server was really pleasant and attentive.

The food was good,  service was bad.  Our server mixed up or drinks then proceeded to insist that she did not. We sat as she walked by our table at least ten times before she came to take our order. Before we were done eating she wanted me to pay on the little machine on my table. And then set the tip at 20%. I wanted to give her a terrible tip but she was standing there holding the machine so I moved it down to 15% that she did not deserve. Let me also mention that we were here for my 7 year olds birthday. They could not swap anything out for the Sunday as my daughter is lactose intolerant and only two staff members came over to sing the most sorry happy birthday song I've ever heard.

It doesn't get much better than RR! Although they appear to have scaled back the amount of fries they give you in their bottomless refills, they're still delicious, and yes, bottomless!  Always great tasting, and fair prices, respectively speaking!

To start off I wanted to say for it being our first time it seemed as if we walked into a disaster.. The vibe I picked up from our waitress Ali was just chaotic. she seemed so irritated with a simple drink order which made me uneasy and this was our first impression. So we ordered our drinks and an appetizer ( bottomless fries) she came back with drinks and left to put in our order.. She came back with chips salsa and guacamole(in which I'm very allergic to)we told her we had ordered fries and was so upset she cut us off and said"apologize I'll get the fries" and left in a huff. Finally after watching her have such a hard time imputing our order she came back and brought our fries STACKED on top of each other.. these are the baskets that they place on the counters on tables and where they hold them to serve..she stacked them on the fresh fries (gross) by this time I was to hungry to care I ate them anyways. So we finished the bottomless fries and a few sodas and she was in the back trying to figure out what was going on with the order and since we could see what she was putting in we knew she had the order wrong...well we pushed the call button  no one ever came back we figured she was so frustrated at everything maybe she quit??? So now I'm thinking well... Wth? THAT was the turning point of our visit. Next thing I knew I saw a beautiful smile ask"are you guys doing ok?" Preneycia (Precee) of course we said no and she FIXED the whole visit she was so in tune with her job(customer service) that she SAVED this place from a 1 and a horrible review. Thank you Precee!  You are a gem! And I appreciate your service personally job well done lady! Thank you for the exquisite service I left that establishment with a smile!

We had am amazing waitress in the bar tonight. I believe her name was Rachel. She was still so friendly even after having to deal with some not so classy ladies at the table across from us. Our food was also great, I just couldn't eat my sandwich after indulging in way too many cheese sticks. If you see this, Rachel,  keep up the great service. :)
Very good experience at this location.  Food came out fast and was delicious.  The place was very clean, and our server was very courteous!!!  I will definitely come back again...
Not a fan of this location. Poor service. Managers have a dont care attitude.

This is my go to place. It is delicious and the prices are pretty fair. Kevin in the bar is always delightful and normally ends up being my waiter. When we say extra ranch they actually seem to understand that. Most places end up having to go back and get more because they extra they give is one teeny cup. Red Robin gets is right. The drinks are super yummy, never had a bad experience here.

I've always been a fan of Red Robins.  This one really is no different than other Red Robins, although the parking can be difficult because Olive Garden parking tends to spill over into Red Robin Parking. Also this Red Robin location seems they have brought back happy hour goodies, good thing too.

Another great trip to Red Robin. As long as I don't go during the busiest part of the day, the waiting time is usually very short. I love that I can still order my favorite 'Rajun Cajun' and the server always knowing what it is even though its been off the menu for nearly five years!! Servers have always been friendly. Its our families regular birthday place.

I just got a call from someone representing Red Robin....he apologized for the event, and has offered a coupon for a discount for my next visit.  Most importantly, he made the call...he listened...he wants to be sure the problem is corrected...and then offers me discount so I AM HAPPY.    Sometimes we just want to be heard.  I'm in customer service...can't make everybody happy...but when you truly try...ITS A BIG DEAL.  Thanks in advance.  Going back Saturday afternoon.

Went there twice. The first time was ok since we just had burgers and fries. The second time was just terrible. Bad service, poor quality food (I don't know what they put in the queso, but it isn't even close to cheese), and the beer was flat and stale. Not worth the money at all.

Food was good. The chocolate I drank was good. The beer I drank was good. That's it. Just good. The atmosphere was good. The server was energetic and positive. I liked this place. Only reason there are not more stars is I have been to better places with better food and really good prices. Standard place, regardless I would recommend this place if you want a bite to eat.

Last night we were served by Heather and had the WORST service I've ever experienced at a Red Robin. The food was pretty good, but the time it took for someone to acknowledge us, and the fact that she was so absent was excessive. We ended up having 5 different people bring us our food and drinks. We intended on going to BJ's brew house which is right next door, but the wait was much longer, and now we know why. We'll definitely wait for a seat next time, and you should too.

I'm a fan of Red Robin - and this is your average Red Robin.  One thing that was a little strange is it seems like three or four different people were serving our table.  It was strange, one person got my drink order, another person brought the drinks, somebody different took care of the food and refils and a different person did the check out, it was a little chaotic. Anyway, the MO of Red Robin is your basic American burger joint with a handfull of other items.  The Onion Rings are good - golden crispy.  Their campfire sauce is pretty good as well - it comes with the onions.  I like the California Chicken Burger.  My favorite part is the fries, they are the broad steak fries, they also have their own seasoning salt on the table...it's pretty good.  This Red Robin gets pretty busy, we had a 15 minute wait at 3:30 on a Sunday afternoon.  I heard that weekends are super insane.
Balloons always a hit with kids. Bottomless fries yummy yummy. Kids menus very easy to read they felt grown up ordering on their own

Came in on a Sunday and was seated right away. The hostess told us that our waitress would bring the kids activity papers (never came). After sitting for about 10 mins she finally came to get our drink order. It took about another 15 mins to take our food order, by now the kids are irritated and have been promised twice for the kids activity paper. So the food finally comes, my aunt asked for ciabatta bread instead of sesame, guess which she got? Then my uncle finds hair in his salad. By this time no one wants to eat their food. Waiting another 10mins for out waitress to show up we showed her the hair and she simply said "that sucks" and takes the plate. The manager comes over and apologizes and offers another salad, after saying no he begins to walk away, it's not til my uncle asks "are you taking this off the bill?" That the manager replies "oh sure." Really? This is the 2nd red robin I've been to that has not so great service. The waitress never offered napkins or anything that would require her to do her job. I did note she was pregnant BUT that's no excuse to not do your job. I think it's safe to say RED ROBIN IS HORRIBLE.
Totally disappointed, what happened to Red Robin? It used to be pretty good, but now the you can get better burgers at Jack in the Box. Very sad. Not sure we will come back. So not worth the cost.

Thank you so much for making me and my friends sick.  This was exactly how we wanted to cheer each other up.  At least we don't have time to think about why we needed cheering up in the first place...with all the time spent with our heads in the toilet.

Still a favorite of mine after many years!  Lots of burger choices.  Bottomless steakfries.  Milkshakes are great!  Prices are very reasonable compared to other comparable restaurants.  Staff is consistently friendly too!

I visited here with three other adults and one child. Checking in at the door was simple and straight-forward; using an iPad, the hostess was able to record our information quickly. Once seated, the server recorded and attended to our drink orders without delay. The food came quickly and tasted great! I think this place would be great for groupings, large and small, as well as individual parties.

Red Robin definitely has my favorite cheeseburger... it is so tasty!  The best part is that you can get a "petite" burger if the regular size burger is just a little too big.  The service is great, and I also enjoy the drinks.  The atmosphere is fun and definitely family-friendly.  And if you get the Red Robin card, you will get a free burger on your birthday!!

I've always been a fan of Red Robin and never had a bad experience, but ever since RR started changing their menu and Décor inside, I have been super unhappy with the food. Bottomless Fries? More like a child's handful of fries! The fry portions are WAY smaller than they used to be, and the burgers have no flavor anymore. I'm a vegetarian, and I know they carry veggie patties to replace meat patties, but the last time I went in I was told they were not able to do that so I ordered several appetizers instead, then a girl at the table next to me ordered a veggie patty and the said no problem! WHAT THE HELL RED ROBIN. I will not be going back at least not to the Puyallup location.

delicous and consistant food. the burgers are to die for and the bottomless fries never disappoint.  sometimes the service4 is less than wonderful and its next to impossible to get an open table in the bar (where happy hour takes place) but if you're willing to take the risk, its worth it.  sometimes my husband and i have to walk out disappointed but when we do get a good seat we're ecsatic about it and always have a wonderful time. if you want a good burger that's worth the wait most of the time, i would defintetly recommend red robin as a place to go!

I always used to come here when I was a teenager with my high school friends. Never had any problems.. I come back here 10 years later and what happened.. Everything was good until I ordered my food. There were 4 of us.. everyone's order was good except mine. I ordered the a1 peppercorn burger with a side of the bacon sauce the waitress brought out our food and my sauce was wrong song let her know and she went back and brought me back the same sauce I already had. She said the cooks didn't know what sauce I was talking about. I showed her a picture in the menu and she took it back again waited about 6 minutes before she came back with the right sauce. Then after taking a couple bites of my burger I tasted paper.. I spit out what was in my mouth and sure enough some paper.. I took apart the half of my burger I had left and the cook left the paper on the cheese.. There were black burn marks in the edges of it.. I was pissed.. I told the manager he got me another burger after 7 minutes but by that time everyone was done eating so I just boxed it up they didn't charge me for it but I never ate the one I boxed up.. Not going back when I go back home again.
my family loves this place. everyone is always so friendly. and the food is consistently delicious.  keep them fries coming!

I went to Red Robin all the time growing up. Hadn't been in awhile so I thought we'd check it out. The service was great and speedy. No complaints there. The food, not so much. I ordered a bacon cheeseburger(just like I've always ordered there) and it was nothing great. In fact, I've seen a better burger at a fast food restaurant. The patty itself was so thin. Usually they are thick and juicy. My plate came with literally 6 fries. I understand it's "bottomless" but seriously?!! 6?!? I was pretty bummed about my order. Won't be back for awhile.
Good Burger :) love their burgers here, and always get good service. Love the Freckled Lemonade :)
Ordered a Bonsai burger W/ crispy fries tarter sauce and a Sam Adams. service was good, and dinner was delicious.

Service was quick and courteous, our food was prepared to our liking and our overall trip was very satisfactory. The only reason for 4 stars instead of 5 is due to the parking situation, it's hard to find a decent parking spot at any time of day.

Slow service, messed up orders, and cold food. Horrible experience. We did have a bigger party but the lack of good service was astounding. Several people didn't even get their food until everyone else had finished theirs.

Red Robin, as anyone who knows me, is my absolute favorite restaurant. Ever. So I was excited when I visited family, and we decided to head over to Red Robin for dinner. Yum! We were immediately seated when we got there, no wait. The server was very nice, making little suggestions such as closing the blinds if needed. Not always typical. Service was average on the other hand. Our server took our drinks, and asked my mom if she wanted sweetener for her tea. She asked for sugar. Drinks are brought out, no sweetener. We then had to track someone down to bring it. We then ordered. We requested the appetizer onion rings. They came, and we weren't given any napkins or silverware. We had to track someone down for a second time to bring it. Gets pretty annoying having to ask for things in a sit down establishment that should be automatic or brought the first time. My baby was also in a sling with her car seat, and was bumped twice by servers. I really didn't want her woken up. The food was good as always. I'm giving this location 3 stars. *I'm noticing quite a few other reviews mentioning that the servers didn't bring napkins or silverware. Wasn't just us!*

I hadn't been to this location in a while, since it always seems to have a waiting list at normal meal times.  But, it was nearby and I was craving a banzai burger, and I actually found a parking spot. Our party of three was seated fairly quickly, although they seemed a bit reluctant to seat us when I said the third member of our party was five minutes behind us. Really? This was my first visit since their remodel. Not impressed. If I want to sit in an uncomfortable booth with people all around me and no kind of sound barriers, I will eat at the local hospital cafeteria.  Our server was the best part of the experience. She was attentive, refilled our drinks, offered ranch for our fries, etc. The food was a little slow to arrive, but with drinks and a football game on, we managed. Now for the food. My son's meal of clucks and shrimp was one cluck shy of being just a cluck. I have never seen two smaller chicken strips at a restaurant. No seriously, these things could go to duel with a fishstick and lose. The shrimps were okay, but with about six on the plate, it left the proteins severely underrepresented.  He even ate the coleslaw, just to try to feel full.  My burger was delicious. I am not complaining about quality, just quantity. If it wasn't for the bottomless fries, I would have complained. But I don't find value in being filled up with fried cheap carbs.  When I pay $50 plus a tip for three people, I want to walk away feeling good about it. In this visit, I didn't.

Nailbanger Here again;They have this great deal going on for a limited time. Two of there Double Tavern Style Burger with a Appetizer or a Dessert for $15. We got the Reds Double with the Onion Ring full tower for $2 more.The burger are a bit smaller than there regular menu items, but they have several to choose from.They offer limitless fry`s.If you have never been they offer a Full bar and a Happy hour , so check out their site for updates. Good Parking and clean Restrooms. Enjoy

We walked in to grab a table and the employee just looked at us.  No comment, no questions...just a stare.  Finally, another person came and asked us about seating.  He tried to seat us in the bar when we wanted a booth.  After quite an exchange, we headed to a booth. Food came out quickly and about 30 minutes after my burger, I started to feel a little queasy.  I never got to the groaning stage, but it gave me a bit of a scare.   I can't get excited about this place, but I didn't expect to walk out looking for antacids later on after the meal.

We have eaten multiple times at Red Robin and have never been dissatisfied with the service or the food. Tonight however, we ordered food the way we usually do, Hamburgers in a lettuce wrap.  They came to us with so little lettuce that I must have looked shocked.  The french fries were certainly not generous.  These were the reasons we came to eat at Red Robin.  We'll be rethinking our dinner plans next time.

Red Robiiiiiin Yum!  For awhile, I wanted Red Robin all the time, but mainly for their endless fries.  On my last visit, my husband ordered a beer and we usually use our military ID.  They usually just look at his birthday and hand it back, but for some reason, our waitress had to TAKE IT and show it to her manager.  Which was really odd and she was gone for a good 5 minutes with it.  So, never do that.  Our waitress was nice and all, but she was practically whispering while talking to us.  Maybe she was new.  Food was great though and came pretty quick.
We have been consistently pleased by Red Robin in various locations including this store.  Food is good, service is great, prices are OK.

I come here every so often,  and when I do I try to get a different burger every time.  The service is a hit or miss. Sometimes it's really good and sometimes it's so, so. I do like that they give you a fee burger on the month of your birthday, they give a free Sunday as well. How can you pass that up? I also like that they encourage you to dip your fries in other sauces besides ketchup and ranch. So all in all, I like this place.

I stayed away from this place for a solid two years or so, maybe longer. I wasn't impressed with most of my visits and in general, wasn't a place I wanted to spend my money. After hearing they were bringing in Sweet Potato fries, I figured I would give them a shot. So my girlfriend and I went in and let them try to pass the test, lol.  Well, long story short, we've been back multiple times. We pretty much only go to the bar and while there have been a few 3 star visits, overall, we prefer it over most places in the area. We enjoy the bottomless fries, the reward club is decent and they have angry orchard on tap. We go once every two weeks or so and no plans to change that.

Used to come here all the time. Nice friendly waitstaff, upbeat atmosphere, food and drinks that were beyond comparison. The last few times we were in it seemed the entire inside of the building had been replaced, including the staff. Where are all the happy employees? Now it's a bunch of people walking around like robots who don't enjoy their jobs. That has an effect on the atmosphere and the taste of the food as well. We could tell when your chef took pride in his work, now it's just like any other burger place. We'll sadly continue to drive past and find other places for dinner. Was hoping it was a fluke but unfortunately it seems the new norm.

I have went to Red Robin many times and the one thing you can count on is their consistency. They have very good burgers, and endless fries. If you are not a fan of french fries you can get a side salad instead at no extra charge. There is no doubt though, for burgers the prices here are pretty high. Strawberry lemonade sure seems to be popular, and I know those type of drinks, like soda, ice tea, lemonade etc, are endless with constant refills. All of there burgers are cooked medium well ( 155 degrees ) If you want them cooked any differently, you will need to let your server know. The fish and chips are very good considering they specialize in burgers.  The restaurant is very lively and inviting with bright colors all around you. When I flew to Washington last month, I brought my grandson and daughter here for dinner. They always give each child  a child's menu with a few color crayons to use that have mazes, things to color etc. Usually they also give kids balloons upon request, In December, we were told that they had a national shortage of helium, so they were unable to give out any at that time This place seems packed each and every time we go there and if your not trying to watch your pennies, then I think you will really enjoy the place.

Came back a year later hoping for improvement..... Nope, still disappointed!!  Table of 10 and we sat down to a carpet full of crumbs from past guest, table super sticky and the booth seat smell like the bleach rag was a month old mop rag, Ugggg!  Drinks arrived quickly.  Food delivered and had to send 2 meals back because special instructions for food was not followed.  Not trying be picky but a big difference when lactose intolerant!!  Make that three plates that have failed!!  The tortilla on the BBQ Whiskey wrap was hard as a rock, the kitchen crew has imploded!!  The manager took that wrap meal off and 25% but now......Wow, this review is in real time.... The burger that was sent back because of mayo (that was requested from the get go to NOT have mayo) was resent and guess what, mayo again!!  It's been a year since eating here and after this 2nd debacle, we're calling it quits.  RIP BBQ Whiskey wrap, I will miss you! BC

Does Red Robin really deserve a review? No. It's Red Robin. It's a tasty burger. Nothing special, nothing fancy, nothing classy. It's a slightly overpriced burger with bottomless fries. I will always enjoy the dirty bird when I go, but it always reminds me of being in high school and feeling like a cool kid, sitting there pestering the server for more fries, honey mustard sauce, and then going outside to join the "original dirty bird," if you've seen the original buildings famous painting.
Poor service.  Meal sucked.  Waitress couldn't even bring us silverware or water.

When in doubt, Red Robin is always a good option.  This is typical burger chain fair in a slightly more upscale fashion.  There're about 20 separate burger options (though with customizations this is pretty much limitless), along with a few pastas, salads, and other fried foods (onion rings, mozzarella sticks, etc). Red Robin isn't so much about the food, though.  When you go here, you're most likely going because you know you're going to get decent-to-above-average service, a clean restaurant, a family-friendly atmosphere, and consistency in taste. Nothing spectacular, but nothing to push you away.  This is just another average American chain restaurant in the middle of suburbia.  It's relatively mindless, but that's what makes it easy.

Server was sweet, but took our order and only saw her after she delivered appetizer for kids and drinks 45 minutes into our dine in. Then 30 more minutes to get our meals, then we needed to switch seats, got some overgrown oaf treat my kids poorly, so I politely (trying to role model for this idiot) asked to move. We were told to move our own things and food as it was too hard for her to carry to the empty table in a non-busy day. Then she got smart with the teenager, never came back for refills, ahppy to drop off bill, had to fetch another server to run teh bill. Called and emailed to complain, got Kristen who said she needed to check it out and never heard from her again. Yet I called last night after sending 2 emails to guest relation and called them only to hear Kristen told them it was covered and a GC was issued. Um, really???? To Whom? Not I. Today I got a message from Kristen. I guess I am going to have to avoid this place. This location is horrible. After seeing reviews, I'm not the only one who had this crap experience. Avoid it if you have kids or large parties. I tipped well, $101 in food and shady service.

VERY POOR SERVICE! Our experience started out with the server coming to our table twice saying hello and she would be right with us. After ordering we had several other servers bring us food for other tables 3 different times, including once after we were done eating... After getting our foods it just got worse from there, waited for 20 minutes for our check, when the server finally came back she told us she brought our check to a different table and they paid it. She then asked us if we would mind paying for thier food so she didnt have to get the manager.  30 minutes later we finally got our correct check. The manager walked by our table, when we asked about the check she immediately left when the server approached our table offer no reasoning as to the confusion.  Very disappointed by the service and the management. Food was ok will for sure go to a different location in the future.

I've been to Red Robin in general over a dozen times.  Mostly, it's been due to either the lack of options or because someone I'm with is in want of a horribly bad for you meaty burger.  Voila, I find myself at this location two weeks ago as the result of a mix between the aforementioned reasons. Have you ever, EVER taken the time to taste JUST the patty?  No sauces, no additives, no veggies...just the meat?  Do it.  What you will find is a vast taste of bland poorly seasoned beef.  I never actually realized that aspect until my most recent visit to the RR here in South Hill.  I guess they're doing fine as is as far as incoming business goes, but should things start going down hill I suggest RR revamps their hours to mirror that of Denny's.  Drunk people hardly suspect, or even care about the taste of what they're consuming so in the most desperate case RR would be in the clear.  Just sayin.

Mediocre at best. Fries are hot usually, but the entree isn't always. Burgers and sandwiches tend to be sloppy. However I do like the red robin franchise, just not this location. The one in lakewood is much better.

Their food is always good, and consistent from Washington to California. The service has been stellar at times, and pretty bad at others, so, like with most places, it just depends. The burgers are good. Love the bottomless fries. Drinks from the bar are fast and great.

Waiting for almost an hour for a table for 10 is ridiculous. Watching group after group get seated while you have three anxious kids is so frustrating. Oh yeah, its my sons birthday. Yay. The girl that seated us was less than thrilled. Our waitress on the other hand, was very nice and in a great mood. They messed up the birthday boys order as well as the other two kids orders. They neglected to tell us that they were out of oranges and just assumed apples would be fine, which they werent as my son hates apples. We shared our fries instead. My burger was on the bland side. To finish it all we had four separate bills and my party of four was the only bill that had automatic gratuity charged to it for 7.50. My husband is an extremely generous tipper and would have given her double that had it not been taken automatically. Needless to say this is a nice reminder as to why we don't frequent this place often.
Manager was outstanding!!! Very busy night and made us feel very special!! Thank you.

Food isn't that bad. Could be worse. However the SMELL!!  Wow, clean the carpets. Sort of hits you in the face when you walk in. And just lingers. My kids really wanted to go here so I tolerated it through the meal, but wow.

Though my husband and I have only gotten food from this location twice,  they somehow managed to get our order wrong on both occasions. Despite our ticket clearly stating that I ordered my burger with NO PINK, both times I could practically hear my patty mooing at me after the first bite. Unfortunately for us they were both to-go orders, resulting in another  15-20 minute drive back to the establishment to get it rectified. Needless to say, we won't be back.

I love the onion ring tour with the campfire sauce and the now discontinued Jamaican chicken burger.  I love the sweet potato fries too.  Why not higher stars?  Last four times I have been customer service sucked.  Not good at keeping water up and never the person who took the order delivers it, and thus has been regularly cold temp.

As far as Red Robins go, this one is about an 8/10.  The food is good and service is similar but it's nothing spectacular.  Their drinks at the bar are weak and watered-down, but who goes to Red Robin to drink seriously anyway?  Lots of local high school and college students working here so the youthful atmosphere is definitely a plus.  Consistently decent.
